content.description: Climb up good ledges & positive crimps on the right side of the Birthday Boulder. Topout can be a bit awkward, make sure to have pads & spotters below. Great, smooth route
Follow the awkward moves up the left arete and face to the top.
content.location: Left arête on the Birthday Boulder

content.description: Start as for Sweet Dreams, but immediately move right, avoiding larger holds out left. Climb up through two distinctive tiny iron rings that form very sharp crimps.
content.location: Large edge at waist height, a few feet left of the right arete. Same start as Cakewalk.

content.description: Start in the second letter box of the main birthday boulder problem, set up with high, poor feet, and think happy thoughts about dynoing to the lip,and not ripping off the top.

Starting at the left arete, traverse right to a crimpy mail slot about head high in the center of the boulder.  Work diagonal right to a crimpy three finger pocket (unless you have sausage fingers, then maybe two).  Keep working up and right from there through a series of bad crimps before a big move to a bomber ledge.  From there pullup to the top and top out.  Crux begins after moving through the pocket, better to hit at the start of your day as the crimps can tear off some skin.
content.protection: A few crash pads are necessary.
content.location: Start on the left arete and traverse into the same mail slot as used as the start for Birthday Boulder before making upward progress.

content.description: Locate the sharp line of edges up the left side of the boulder 5ft to the right of the arête. Follow these up and lunge for the jug.
content.location: 5ft to the right of the arête and just left of Birtday Boulder route.

content.description: Start on two small crimps below a three finger pocket. Climb straight up through crimps to the horizontal break for an easy topout.
content.location: Just right of the middle of the face, with the distinctive letterbox holds of Birthday Boulder to your left and the large edges of Cakewalk to your right. The Cutting Edge climbs the line between them.

content.description: Start in the middle of the boulder. Start in the lower letterbox and the make two moves to the second letterbox. Continue up to the left on a weird, pockety crimp. Get your feet up, and make a balancey cross-over with your right hand to a flake. Then a few easy moves to top out.
content.location: Drive up rim road until you see two signs, one on each side of the road. There are a couple of small pull offs. Park in one of these and look for a pyramid shaped rock sticking up over the main cliff. that's the top of birthday.

content.description: The Birthday Boulder on Rim Road at McConnells Mill.
